name: Hockey Hockey Club (Demo)
description:
Hockey Hockey Club is a feel good ice hockey game with the cutest and wobbliest animals of the whole polar circle. But don't be fooled by their adorable little faces, Hockey Hockey Club is a die-hard hockey game with all the usual hockey stuffs (5 on 5 games, faceoffs, one timers, bodychecks, one on ones , ...) and a twist of arcadey moves (super shots, flips, slowmo...).

Eight teams of determined hockey players are present in the game with a lot of statistics for all the numbers fans: stamina, speed, handling, shoot... Pick the best teammates to defeat the other teams!

Play against the computer (3 levels of difficulty), or play with your friends locally (for up to 4 players). You can even play the game online with the help of the fantastic Parsec® technology!

  • Fun and accessible gameplay
  • True ice hockey features: faceoffs, penalties, one-timers, one on one, that small organ jingle,...
  • Arcade moves: build up your super meter and throw some devastating super shots
  • Various camera angles and instant replays
  • 3 computer levels (Medium is hard already!!)
  • Play with up to 4 players locally or remotely (with Parsec®)
  • Real snow simulated physics (or almost)
  • Full controller support (you can also play with keyboard & mouse)

So, why a demo?

Well, as you may or may not know, I'm a solo dev, and before committing to a full size project, I'd like to get some feedback whether the core gameplay is solid enough or not. I've been fiddling with this Hockey Hockey Club game for 4 months now, and I don't know if I should keep a small scope, or if I should go for a fully fleshed sports game with season/franchise mode, player customization,..., or even if I should drop it plain and simple.

So please, I need your feedback, on everything: is the game fun? is the game hard? is the game running smoothly? do you see yourself playing more of it? what feature would you be adding?...  Every comment or remark will be helpful.

Also, the demo is limited to only 2 teams, only exhibition matches of 90 seconds, but you can enjoy all of the 3 AI levels, play with your friends locally or even remotely with Parsec®.
